imr.matrix

Class Vector

  • java.lang.Object
    • imr.matrix.Vector

  • public final class Vector
extends java.lang.Object
    The Vector class defines the most common methods applied to vectors. In addition, methods to print, load a vector from a file and store the content of a vector into a file are also implemented.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Vector(int size)
      Makes a new instance of a Vector object.
      Vector(java.lang.String fileName)
      Makes a new instance of a Vector object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Vector

        public Vector(int size)
        Makes a new instance of a Vector object.
        Parameters:
        size - number of elements. The object is initialized having size elements and all positions are set to zero.

      • Vector

        public Vector(java.lang.String fileName)
        Makes a new instance of a Vector object.
        Parameters:
        fileName - a well formatted file. The vector is initialized according the information stored in the file passed as parameter.

        The format is as follows: 

         #elements
v0 v1 v2...vn

        Example.

        A 10 elements vector file: 

         10
3 4 5 8 6 0 1 0 9 4

    • Method Detail

      • print

        public void print()
        shows the content of a vector

      • load

        public void load(java.lang.String fileName)
        Loads a vector from a file.
        Parameters:
        fileName - a well formatted file. The vector is initialized according to the information stored in the file passed as parameter.

        To know how such a file format is, see the constructor's section.

      • store

        public void store(java.lang.String fileName)
        Stores the content of a vector into a file.
        Parameters:
        fileName - file to write.

        To know how such a file format is, see the constructor's section.

      • get

        public double get(int i)
        Gets a value from a vector.
        Parameters:
        i - index
        Returns:
        the value stored in the index position.

      • set

        public void set(int i,
                double value)
        Sets a value to the specified position.
        Parameters:
        i - index position.
        value - a value to set.

      • size

        public int size()
        Gets the size of the vector, that is, the number of elements.
        Returns:
        the size of the vector.

      • get

        public Vector get(int fromIndex,
                  int toIndex)
        Gets a chunk from a vector.
        Parameters:
        fromIndex - first index.
        toIndex - last index.
        Returns:
        a vector which content is the extracted chunk.

        If you have a vector and want to get a chunk from index 2 to 4 

         Vector chunk = v.get(2,4);

      • resize

        public void resize(int newSize)
        Resizes a vector.
        Parameters:
        newSize -

        If newSize is greater than the vector to be resized, new positions are set to zero.

        If it is lower, the vector is truncated to the new size.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Vector v)
        Evaluates the vector to be equal to the one passed as parameter.
        Parameters:
        v - vector to evaluate its equality.
        Returns:
        true if both vectors are equal or false otherwise.

      • clone

        public java.lang.Object clone()
        Clones a vector.
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the cloned vector.

        You must cast to Vector

        Vector cloned = (Vector)v.clone();

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Gets a string representation of the vector.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a string representation of the vector.
